.@MarkOlalde 1/2 Green cards and work/study visas do not give you an irrevocable right of entry to the US. Imm. officers can and do...
.@MarkOlalde Dual citizens are still citizens of the US. Permanent residents have, in practical terms, almost no rights at points of entry.
.@MarkOlalde As in, they can bar you entry for any reason, and they don't have to disclose that reason to you when they do it.
.@MarkOlalde Unless you're a citizen, US immigration officials can do pretty much what they like with you at ports of entry.
